page.title: 17HALE LIBRARY AND RECREATION.
page.content: The{library}in Hale is a popular meeting place, built in 1966 with an extension opened in l974 it is situated in the housing and shopping area and consequently is well used. Access to the library for people in wheel chairs was found to be good. The survey group were able to find a great deal of information on local clubs and societies and the display area in the foyer is well used throughout the year by such groups as the{Scouts and {Guides}and local artists. Of note is the Guide camp site in Ashley and the {Hale Ornithologists}which are well known in South Manchester. Such societies reflect the rural and wealthier nature of the area. The many stables in the area, for example, makes{horse riding}a popular form of recreation.
